info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL ALAMANCE AND NORTHEASTERN GUILFORD COUNTIES... At 429 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over McLeansville, or 9 miles west of Burlington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Burlington, Graham, McLeansville, Elon, Gibsonville, Haw River, Alamance, Lake Guilford Mackintosh Marina and Monticello. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
